climbs.name: Up above the stars and bars

content.description: Sit start with a knee bar for the first move following the arete up about four feet to the start of the line of crimp running to the right to a crack in the boulder topping out on what i think are the last sequences to stars and bars

A bouldery start. Depending on which style of climbing you're more comfortable with, the crux can come early or later. Crack lovers will find the wider crack after the ledge enjoyable, albeit short. Very dirty, hence slippery. This route needs a lot of cleaning.
content.protection: Standard Rack will do, though BD Cam 2 & 3 can come in handy later.
content.location: Obvious start, left of Layback King.

content.description: Sit start to grey paint, start on the left arete and move low to the right into the start of grey paint
SDS left foot on small ledge right above water, right foot up high on ledgeWork your way left on the best sloping edge in OHIO!
content.location: Past “Feces”Before “Grey Paint” boulder Right next/in the river

content.description: Start seated on the right side and traverse around to the beauty slopers out left. Throw up to the chip and mantle.
content.location: Upstream of "Grey Paint" on the next large boulderLAT/LONG: 41.374547, -82.107907

content.description: Look right of the grey paint seam and find the arete next to the water with the broken tree at the base. Climb on.
use up above stars and bars up until second rail then go straight up the highest point of the boulder of this side of the arête
Find the line of bolts on the far end of the boulder. Around the corner, climb up through the marginal face holds to the top, avoiding the arete

No obvious crux, unless trying to climb up to the tree anchor. Very blank face after the ledge. Climb the obvious, sharp crack. Laybacking will get you to the top ledge. Good feet, good holds, just sharp and dirty. Some moss in the upper part of the crack. Different variation of finishes, I traversed right at the end of the crack.

Start low with bad feet, move right to obvious good dimples, dyno to a sharp pocket, climb up using SHARP holds to the top. Some holds require for a mono undercling. Finish is very balancy. Very fun, bouldery climb. Must use trees to make a TR anchor. Will not take any gear. This area needs a lot of cleaning; every other hold broke off, and cannot guarantee the ones used will stay.
content.protection: TR anchor must be set using tree(s)

content.description: Follow underclings and edges next to seam, large moves punctuate the top of the boulder.
content.location: Largest boulder DownStream on Elywood Park side. LAT/LONG: 41.374752, -82.107825

content.description: start on low jug, bump right up rightbring left foot to heel hook on jugreach for the nose
content.location: Upstream about 500ft from "Grey Paint" BoulderThis boulder is away from the river.Just down hill from an old wooden barn on the ridge lineLAT/LONG: 41.373568, -82.107770

content.description: A real fun flake going straight up the cliff, the moves are really reachy and fun with alot of side pulls.  You can set up toprope off the tree directly above the route(be careful walking above the cliff the dirt is slanted and loose, also be cognizant of not walking up to high above the cliff into people's backyards) or place some protection in the cracks.  The crux is towards the top of the flake where there is a very long reach to the next possible hand hold.  A bit chossy in some areas but overall a pretty fun route
content.protection: Be careful of rock integrity, if attempting to place protection on this route.
content.location: walk down directly behind elyria baptist church and take a right turn at the river.  Its about a 10 minute walk and the cliffs will be to your right

content.description: start on a flake left pinch and obvious right hand placement right toe then pop straight up to the first ledge then a nice heal hook to pop to the next ledge
Berea Sandstone / Large amounts of paint, cannot miss it. Near the river.
